Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "(keep-alive): do not use the cache which has been destroyed" (#7151) at vuejs/vue
Opened issue "vue-router doesn't work on IOS 10.3.2 (14F89) but works on IOS 11.2 (15C114)" (#1933) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/fLswsLzh/](https://jsfiddle.net/fLswsLzh/)

### Steps to reproduce
1.- Open fiddle
2.- The router links are not available for IOS 10 (ipad mini 4 and ipad pro devices) either on Safari or Chrome browsers but they are available and work as expected on IOS 11 (ipad mini 4)


### What is expected?
You should be able to access the router links

### What is actually happening?
Router links are not available for IOS 10 (Ipad Mini 4 and Ipad Pro) but they are available on IOS 11 as expected.

---
Behavior can easily reproduce on both devices using Safari and Chrome browsers.

Do you have this bug confirmed? and, which version is preferred to use on IOS 10 then?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Type declaration incomplete for Location.query" (#1932) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/82013/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/82013/) (This doesn't actually work, but shows the code you'd need locally to repro the bug)

### Steps to reproduce
0. Note that JSFiddle doesn't appear to give Typescript compiler errors, so the repro linked will have to be ported into a local Typescript Vue project.

1. In a Typescript Vue project:
```
router.push({ query: { array: [1,2,3] }})
```

### What is expected?
This should compile without error 

### What is actually happening?
You get an error:
```
 error TS2345: Argument of type '{ name: string; query: QueryParams; }' is not assignable to parameter of type 'RawLocation'.
  Type '{ name: string; query: QueryParams; }' is not assignable to type 'Location'.
    Types of property 'query' are incompatible.
      Type 'QueryParams' is not assignable to type 'Dictionary<string> | undefined'.
        Type 'QueryParams' is not assignable to type 'Dictionary<string>'.
          Index signatures are incompatible.
            Type 'string | string[] | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'.
              Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'.
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
